img.title: Fergus High from Casino Creek Drive
img.alt: Fergus High from Casino Creek Drive

div.a: Educational Plan for the Remainder of the School Year 2019-2020

span.p: After surveying our teachers, receiving input from the Fergus County Health, Fergus County Emergency Services and Central Montana Medical Center and in evaluating Governor Bullock's School Opening Guidelines from April 22, 2020, the School Board of Trustees approved the following recommendation at the April 28th, 2020, Special Board Meeting.

ol.li: For the safety and health of our staff and students, we will continue providing online learning and distribution of learning packets for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

All formal instruction for grade promotional readiness or high school credit will be completed by May 15th. New instructional material will not be presented after May 15th, unless needed for course completion and promotional readiness.

The weeks following May 15th will be used to assist students who have not met the grade promotional readiness standards. This time will be used for students needing credit recovery to ensure they have met graduation standards and maintain eligibility for activities for the fall semester or 1st quarter 2020-2021. In addition, those students wishing to raise their grade may choose to continue to work on their progress. Students have the option to continue with online instruction or they may make appointments with their respective school to receive direct, face-to-face instruction that meet all Governor Bullock’s School Reopening Considerations, CDC and Fergus County Health social distancing requirements. Students who are at high risk or who have family members who are at high risk will not be penalized for failing to attend and will continue to receive remote support.

span.p: At this time the Lewistown Public School Leadership Team is drafting a recommendation on how to proceed with the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year for our district. We are considering many factors which include the Governor's Reopening Guidelines for schools, input from our local disaster/emergency services office, our local health district, and teachers as we construct this recommendation.

The final recommendation will then be presented to the LPS School Board early next week for its approval. Once a plan is approved by the school board, a statement will be released to our parents and local community outlining how we will proceed.
School elections ballots were mailed April 15th. Please vote!

p.em: Click the image to download a printable PDF version of this fact sheet.

span.p: Students, Parents and Staff .. Governor Bullock has extended school closures through April 24th. We will continue to deliver meals and distance learning instruction during this time. Any questions should be directed to your specific school office, teacher websites or the Lincoln Building (535-8777 ext 110).

Please remember our regularly scheduled Spring Break starts Friday, April 10th and continues through Tuesday, April 14th. There will be no meals served during that time and we encourage everyone to enjoy a much needed break!

Please be aware Lewistown Public Schools will not be serving meals to the children in our community on scheduled non-school days. This includes the upcoming break on April 10th through the 14th. Also, beginning on Monday, April 6th, there will be additional items added to the meals to provide breakfast for children on the following day. Thank you for allowing your kids to eat with us!

Dear Parents and Guardians:
At this time we are postponing our Kindergarten Screening dates scheduled for April 1st and 2nd. We will look at rescheduling the screening later in the spring to ensure we have all our incoming kindergarten kids placed in classes for this fall. This is just a precaution to ensure the safety and welfare of our staff and all families involved.
If you have questions please contact Garfield School by phone, (406)535-2366, or email Mr. Lewis at mlewis@lewistown.k12.mt.us

img.alt: Online Resources from our School Counselors

span.p: Please take some time to check out our school counselors' websites. Mrs. LaRowe, Mrs. Jenness, Mrs. Majerus and Mrs. Durbin all have websites that can be accessed from the Teacher Webpages at each school. They have have included many great resources and helpful tips for navigating this surreal time. Our counselors are available daily for our students so please do not hesitate to reach out!

In support of our students and parents we have included a quick menu to access teacher and staff webpages. For more information, digital backpacks and school contact information please go to each school's webpage.

div.a: Safety Tips from LPS School Nurse Leisha Armstrong

span.p: It is highly encouraged for students to start practicing for the ACT tests coming up this year. There are two tests offered in Lewistown that students can register for on October 26 (Sept. 20th registration deadline) and December 14 (Nov. 8th registration deadline). Please see Mrs. Durbin to get your information to register for the ACT tests BEFORE you actually register online. Thank you. All juniors will also take the test on March 24, during the school day, at Fergus High School.
To practice for the ACT test, students can access and use the following two free resources:
